page.title: 01Norton-on-Derwent
page.content:
Norton-on-Derwent is a progressive and expanding town situated to the south of the river Derwent and halfway between York and Scarborough. It lies, approximately, midway between the North Yorkshire Moors and the Yorkshire Wolds forming a district of 6500 people.
Norton-on-Derwent is connected to the adjoining town of Malton by two road bridges. In 1974, the year of local government reorganisation, the town of Norton was renamed Norton-on Derwent to avoid confusion with the many other places bearing the same name.
As anyone in Norton-on-Derwent will be quick to point out, both Malton bus and railway stations are in Norton.The many famous horses trained in Malton are again from stables in Norton.
